CWE-294.name: Authentication Bypass by Capture-replay
CWE-294.description: A capture-replay flaw exists when the design of the software makes it possible for a malicious user to sniff network traffic and bypass authentication by replaying it to the server in question to the same effect as the original message (or with minor changes).

CWE-290.name: Authentication Bypass by Spoofing
CWE-290.description: This attack-focused weakness is caused by improperly implemented authentication schemes that are subject to spoofing attacks.

CWE-639.name: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
CWE-639.description: The system's authorization functionality does not prevent one user from gaining access to another user's data or record by modifying the key value identifying the data.

CWE-120.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')
CWE-120.description: The program copies an input buffer to an output buffer without verifying that the size of the input buffer is less than the size of the output buffer, leading to a buffer overflow.

CWE-312.name: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
CWE-312.description: The application stores sensitive information in cleartext within a resource that might be accessible to another control sphere.

CWE-319.name: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
CWE-319.description: The software transmits sensitive or security-critical data in cleartext in a communication channel that can be sniffed by unauthorized actors.

CWE-362.name: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')
CWE-362.description: The program contains a code sequence that can run concurrently with other code, and the code sequence requires temporary, exclusive access to a shared resource, but a timing window exists in which the shared resource can be modified by another code sequence that is operating concurrently.

CWE-352.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
CWE-352.description: The web application does not, or can not, sufficiently verify whether a well-formed, valid, consistent request was intentionally provided by the user who submitted the request.

CWE-502.name: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
CWE-502.description: The application deserializes untrusted data without sufficiently verifying that the resulting data will be valid.

CWE-425.name: Direct Request ('Forced Browsing')
CWE-425.description: The web application does not adequately enforce appropriate authorization on all restricted URLs, scripts, or files.

CWE-369.name: Divide By Zero
CWE-369.description: The product divides a value by zero.

CWE-415.name: Double Free
CWE-415.description: The product calls free() twice on the same memory address, potentially leading to modification of unexpected memory locations.

CWE-494.name: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
CWE-494.description: The product downloads source code or an executable from a remote location and executes the code without sufficiently verifying the origin and integrity of the code.

CWE-834.name: Excessive Iteration
CWE-834.description: The software performs an iteration or loop without sufficiently limiting the number of times that the loop is executed.

CWE-668.name: Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere
CWE-668.description: The product exposes a resource to the wrong control sphere, providing unintended actors with inappropriate access to the resource.

CWE-200.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
CWE-200.description: The product exposes sensitive information to an actor that is not explicitly authorized to have access to that information.

CWE-610.name: Externally Controlled Reference to a Resource in Another Sphere
CWE-610.description: The product uses an externally controlled name or reference that resolves to a resource that is outside of the intended control sphere.

CWE-552.name: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties
CWE-552.description: The product makes files or directories accessible to unauthorized actors, even though they should not be.

CWE-209.name: Generation of Error Message Containing Sensitive Information
CWE-209.description: The software generates an error message that includes sensitive information about its environment, users, or associated data.

CWE-287.name: Improper Authentication
CWE-287.description: When an actor claims to have a given identity, the software does not prove or insufficiently proves that the claim is correct.

CWE-295.name: Improper Certificate Validation
CWE-295.description: The software does not validate, or incorrectly validates, a certificate.

CWE-273.name: Improper Check for Dropped Privileges
CWE-273.description: The software attempts to drop privileges but does not check or incorrectly checks to see if the drop succeeded.

CWE-754.name: Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions
CWE-754.description: The software does not check or incorrectly checks for unusual or exceptional conditions that are not expected to occur frequently during day to day operation of the software.

CWE-913.name: Improper Control of Dynamically-Managed Code Resources
CWE-913.description: The software does not properly restrict reading from or writing to dynamically-managed code resources such as variables, objects, classes, attributes, functions, or executable instructions or statements.

CWE-94.name: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
CWE-94.description: The software constructs all or part of a code segment using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the syntax or behavior of the intended code segment.

CWE-116.name: Improper Encoding or Escaping of Output
CWE-116.description: The software prepares a structured message for communication with another component, but encoding or escaping of the data is either missing or done incorrectly. As a result, the intended structure of the message is not preserved.

CWE-924.name: Improper Enforcement of Message Integrity During Transmission in a Communication Channel
CWE-924.description: The software establishes a communication channel with an endpoint and receives a message from that endpoint, but it does not sufficiently ensure that the message was not modified during transmission.

CWE-178.name: Improper Handling of Case Sensitivity
CWE-178.description: The software does not properly account for differences in case sensitivity when accessing or determining the properties of a resource, leading to inconsistent results.

CWE-755.name: Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions
CWE-755.description: The software does not handle or incorrectly handles an exceptional condition.

CWE-665.name: Improper Initialization
CWE-665.description: The software does not initialize or incorrectly initializes a resource, which might leave the resource in an unexpected state when it is accessed or used.

NVD-CWE-noinfo.name: Insufficient Information
NVD-CWE-noinfo.description: There is insufficient information about the issue to classify it; details are unkown or unspecified.

NVD-CWE-Other.name: Other
NVD-CWE-Other.description: NVD is only using a subset of CWE for mapping instead of the entire CWE, and the weakness type is not covered by that subset.

CWE-276.name: Incorrect Default Permissions
CWE-276.description: During installation, installed file permissions are set to allow anyone to modify those files.
